newsitem.title: CANADA: T-D bids for Australian discount broker.
newsitem.headline: T-D bids for Australian discount broker.

text.p: Toronto-Dominion Bank said on Monday its wholly owned unit, Green Line Holdings (Australia) Pty Ltd, has offered to buy the shares of Pont Securities Ltd, Australia's leading discount brokerage firm.
The offer of C$32.4 million ($29.8 million Australian) or C$3.87 per share ($3.57 Australian) is effective May 8.

T-D said employees and management are expected to be unaffected by the merger. But the merged entity would over time begin offering certain services which Green Line and New York-based Waterhouse Investor Services Inc give customers, such as electronic order taking over the Internet.

"Our aim in making this offer for Australia's leading discount broker is to participate in the active and growing Australian market and expand the services we currently offer to our North American customers," Keith Gray, executive vice-president at T-D and chairman and chief executive of Green Line Investor Services, said in a statement.
Pont Securities, established in 1984, is Australia's original and leading discount brokerage firm with offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Adelaide, Perth, Brisbane, Gold Coast and Canberra.
T-D's Green Line Investor Services and Waterhouse Investor Services Inc. of New York, combine to represent the third largest discount brokerage business worldwide.
